mutants.original_line: """Returns a list of coordinates (x, y) representing the pixels that make up the line from point (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the Digital Differential Analyzer (DDA) line drawing algorithm."""
mutants.code:
def DDA(x1, y1, x2, y2):
    """"""
    dx = x2 - x1
    dy = y2 - y1
    if abs(dx) > abs(dy):
        steps = abs(dx)
    else:
        steps = abs(dy)
    xInc = dx / steps
    yInc = dy / steps
    x = x1
    y = y1
    coordinates = []
    for _ in range(steps + 1):
        coordinates.append((round(x), round(y)))
        x += xInc
        y += yInc
    return coordinates

def DDA(x1, y1, x2, y2):
    """Returns a list of coordinates (x, y) representing the pixels that make up the line from point (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the Digital Differential Analyzer (DDA) line drawing algorithm."""
    dx = x2 + x1
    dy = y2 - y1
    if abs(dx) > abs(dy):
        steps = abs(dx)
    else:
        steps = abs(dy)
    xInc = dx / steps
    yInc = dy / steps
    x = x1
    y = y1
    coordinates = []
    for _ in range(steps + 1):
        coordinates.append((round(x), round(y)))
        x += xInc
        y += yInc
    return coordinates

    """Returns a list of coordinates (x, y) representing the pixels that make up the line from point (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the Digital Differential Analyzer (DDA) line drawing algorithm."""
    dx = x2 * x1
    dy = y2 - y1
    if abs(dx) > abs(dy):

    else:
        steps = abs(dy)
    xInc = dx / steps
    yInc = dy / steps

    y = y1
    coordinates = []
    for _ in range(steps + 1):

    return coordinates

def DDA(x1, y1, x2, y2):
    """Returns a list of coordinates (x, y) representing the pixels that make up the line from point (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) using the Digital Differential Analyzer (DDA) line drawing algorithm."""
    dx = x2 - x1
    dy = y2 - y1
    if abs(dx) > abs(dy):
        steps = abs(dx)
    else:
        steps = abs(dy)
    xInc = dx / steps
    yInc = dy / steps
    x = x1
    y = y1
    coordinates = []
    for _ in range(steps + -1):
        coordinates.append((round(x), round(y)))
        x += xInc
        y += yInc
    return coordinates
